dependencies.name: dart:core
dependencies.comment:
Built-in types, collections,
and other core functionality for every Dart program.

This library is automatically imported.

Some classes in this library,
such as [String] and [num],
support Dart's built-in data types.
Other classes, such as [List] and [Map], provide data structures
for managing collections of objects.
And still other classes represent commonly used types of data
such as URIs, dates and times, and errors.

## Numbers and booleans

[int] and [double] provide support for Dart's built-in numerical data types:
integers and double-precision floating point numbers, respectively.
An object of type [bool] is either true or false.
Variables of these types can be constructed from literals:

    int meaningOfLife = 42;
    double valueOfPi  = 3.141592;
    bool visible      = true;

## Strings and regular expressions

A [String] is immutable and represents a sequence of characters.

    String shakespeareQuote = "All the world's a stage, ...";

[StringBuffer] provides a way to construct strings efficiently.

    StringBuffer moreShakespeare = new StringBuffer();
    moreShakespeare.write('And all the men and women ');
    moreShakespeare.write('merely players; ...');

The String and StringBuffer classes implement string concatenation,
interpolation, and other string manipulation features.

    String philosophy = 'Live on ';
    String get palindrome => philosophy + philosophy.split('').reversed.join();

[RegExp] implements Dart regular expressions,
which provide a grammar for matching patterns within text.
For example, here's a regular expression that matches
a string of one or more digits:

    var numbers = new RegExp(r'\d+');

Dart regular expressions have the same syntax and semantics as
JavaScript regular expressions. See
<http://ecma-international.org/ecma-262/5.1/#sec-15.10>
for the specification of JavaScript regular expressions.

## Collections

The dart:core library provides basic collections,
such as [List], [Map], and [Set].

A List is an ordered collection of objects, with a length.
Lists are sometimes called arrays.
Use a List when you need to access objects by index.

    List superheroes = [ 'Batman', 'Superman', 'Harry Potter' ];

A Set is an unordered collection of unique objects.
You cannot get an item by index (position).
Adding a duplicate item has no effect.

    Set villains = new Set();
    villains.add('Joker');
    villains.addAll( ['Lex Luther', 'Voldemort'] );

A Map is an unordered collection of key-value pairs.
Maps are sometimes called associative arrays because
maps associate a key to some value for easy retrieval.
Keys are unique.
Use a Map when you need to access objects
by a unique identifier.

    Map sidekicks = { 'Batman': 'Robin',
                      'Superman': 'Lois Lane',
                      'Harry Potter': 'Ron and Hermione' };

In addition to these classes,
dart:core contains [Iterable],
an interface that defines functionality
common in collections of objects.
Examples include the ability
to run a function on each element in the collection,
to apply a test to each element,
to retrieve an object, and to determine length.

Iterable is implemented by List and Set,
and used by Map for its keys and values.

For other kinds of collections, check out the
[dart:collection](#dart-collection) library.

## Date and time

Use [DateTime] to represent a point in time
and [Duration] to represent a span of time.

You can create DateTime objects with constructors
or by parsing a correctly formatted string.

    DateTime now = new DateTime.now();
    DateTime berlinWallFell = new DateTime(1989, 11, 9);
    DateTime moonLanding = DateTime.parse("1969-07-20");

Create a Duration object specifying the individual time units.

    Duration timeRemaining = new Duration(hours:56, minutes:14);

In addition to DateTime and Duration,
dart:core contains the [Stopwatch] class for measuring elapsed time.

## Uri

A [Uri] object represents a uniform resource identifier,
which identifies a resource on the web.

    Uri dartlang = Uri.parse('http://dartlang.org/');

## Errors

The [Error] class represents the occurrence of an error
during runtime.
Subclasses of this class represent specific kinds of errors.

## Other documentation

For more information about how to use the built-in types, refer to
[Built-in Types](http://www.dartlang.org/docs/dart-up-and-running/contents/ch02.html#built-in-types)
in Chapter 2 of
[Dart: Up and Running](http://www.dartlang.org/docs/dart-up-and-running/).

Also, see
[dart:core - Numbers, Collections, Strings, and More](http://www.dartlang.org/docs/dart-up-and-running/contents/ch03.html#ch03-dartcore---strings-collections-and-more)
for more coverage of classes in this package.

The
[Dart Language Specification](http://www.dartlang.org/docs/spec/)
provides technical details.

children.name: Object
children.comment:
The base class for all Dart objects.

Because Object is the root of the Dart class hierarchy,
every other Dart class is a subclass of Object.

When you define a class, you should override [toString]
to return a string describing an instance of that class.
You might also need to define [hashCode] and [==], as described in the
[Implementing map keys]
(http://www.dartlang.org/docs/dart-up-and-running/contents/ch03.html#ch03-implementing-map-keys)
section of the [library tour]
(http://www.dartlang.org/docs/dart-up-and-running/contents/ch03.html).

The equality operator.

The default behavior for all [Object]s is to return true if and
only if [:this:] and [other] are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on
a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation.
That is, it must be:

 * Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw
   or return `null`.

 * Reflexive: For all objects `o`, `o == o` must be true.

 * Symmetric: For all objects `o1` and `o2`, `o1 == o2` and `o2 == o1` must
   either both be true, or both be false.

 * Transitive: For all objects `o1`, `o2`, and `o3`, if `o1 == o2` and
   `o2 == o3` are true, then `o1 == o3` must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects
should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects
was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override
the [hashCode] method as well to maintain consistency.

children.name: toString
children.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

children.name: noSuchMethod
children.comment:
[noSuchMethod] is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method
on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the
invocation are passed to [noSuchMethod] in an [Invocation].
If [noSuchMethod] returns a value, that value becomes the result of
the original invocation.

The default behavior of [noSuchMethod] is to throw a
[NoSuchMethodError].

children.name: hashCode
children.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the
same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality
operator [:==:]. Other than that there are no guarantees about
the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and
there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides [hashCode] it should override the
equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

children.name: runtimeType
children.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

Creates a new [Object] instance.

[Object] instances have no meaningful state, and are only useful
through their identity. An [Object] instance is equal to itself
only.

children.name: Exception
children.comment:
A marker interface implemented by all core library exceptions.

An [Exception] is intended to convey information to the user about a failure,
so that the error can be addressed programmatically. It is intended to be
caught, and it should contain useful data fields.

Creating instances of [Exception] directly with [:new Exception("message"):]
is discouraged, and only included as a temporary measure during development,
until the actual exceptions used by a library are done.

children.name: httpRequest
children.comment:
Processes the HTTP request returning the  HTTP response as
a JSON Object

children.name: getString
children.comment: Specialised get for change notifications

children.name: _requestChanges
children.comment: Request the change notifications

children.name: processDbChange
children.comment: Database change updates

children.name: stopNotifications
children.comment: Stop change notifications

children.name: restartChangeNotifications
children.comment: Restart change notifications

children.name: _parameters
children.comment: Parameters set

children.name: _dbName
children.comment: Database name

children.name: _host
children.comment: Host name

children.name: _port
children.comment: Port number

children.name: _scheme
children.comment: HTTP scheme

children.name: _timer
children.comment: Timer

children.name: _sequence
children.comment: Since sequence number

children.name: _paused
children.comment: Paused indicator

children.name: _changeNotification
children.comment:
Change notification stream controller

Populated with WiltChangeNotificationEvent events

children.name: UPDATE
children.comment:
Update event

A document has been created/updated

children.name: DELETE
children.comment:
Delete event

A document has been deleted

children.name: DECODE_ERROR
children.comment:
Decode error event

The change notification recieved from CouchDB cannot be 
transformed into valid JSON, this may be a temporary issue,
the client must decide whether to continue on or re-initialise
the change notification class.

children.name: COUCHDB_ERROR
children.comment:
CouchDb error event

The change notification recieved from CouchDB indicates an error.

children.name: ABORT
children.comment:
Abort event

A fatal error in the HTTP client has been detected, the client must
assume that on recieveing the event the change notification interface must
be re-initialised.

children.name: LAST_SEQUENCE
children.comment:
Last sequence number event

Sent by CouchDB when there are no changes, only the last sequence number is returned.

children.name: _type
children.comment:
Type

Valid for all events

children.name: _sequenceNumber
children.comment:
Sequence Number

Valid for update, delete and sequence

children.name: _docId
children.comment:
Document identifier

Valid for update and delete

children.name: _docRevision
children.comment:
Document revision

Valid for update and delete but optional

children.name: _document
children.comment:
Document object

Valid for update and only if includeDocs is true

children.name: _exception
children.comment:
Exception string

Valid for abort and decode error

children.name: _httpResponseText
children.comment:
HTTP response text

Valid for decode error

children.name: _couchError
children.comment:
Couch error

Valid for update and delete

children.name: _couchReason
children.comment:
Couch reason

Valid for update and delete

children.name: update
children.comment: Update event

children.name: delete
children.comment: Delete event

children.name: decodeError
children.comment: Decode error event

children.name: abort
children.comment: Abort event

children.name: couchDbError
children.comment: CouchDB error event

children.name: sequence
children.comment: Sequence number event

children.name: _since
children.comment:
Since

Start the results from the change immediately after the given sequence number

children.name: _descending
children.comment:
Descending

Return the change results in descending sequence order (most recent change first)

children.name: _heartbeat
children.comment:
Heartbeat

Period in milliseconds between notification requests to CouchDB
Be sensible with this, 1 second between requests is a good minimum.

children.name: _includeDocs
children.comment:
Include documents

Include the associated document with each result. If there are conflicts, 
only the winning revision is returned

children.name: _includeAttachments
children.comment:
Include attachments

Include any associated document attachments with each result. 
This will retrieve the body of the attachment in Base64 format
as well as the stub data that is normally suppplied.

children.name: getDocumentId
children.comment: Get a document id from a JSON Object

children.name: getDocumentRev
children.comment: Get a revision from a JSON object

children.name: addDocumentRev
children.comment: Adds a CouchDB _rev to the JSON body of a document

children.name: addDocumentId
children.comment: Adds a CouchDB _id to the JSON body of a document

children.name: createBulkInsertString
children.comment:
Creates a JSON string for bulk inserts where an 
_id and or _rev is needed.

children.name: getAttachments
children.comment:
Get a list of attachments from a document.

Returned Json Object contains the fields 'name' and 'data', the data
being the attachment data returned from CouchDb.

children.name: resultCompletion=
children.comment: Completion callback

children.name: _httpRequest
children.comment:
The internal HTTP request method. This wraps the
 HTTP adapter class.

children.name: _setURLParameter
children.comment:
Takes a URL and key/value pair for a URL parameter and adds this
to the query parameters of the URL.

children.name: _conditionUrl
children.comment:
Conditions the URL for use by Wilt and checks for 
a valid database by default.

children.name: httpRequest
children.comment:
Basic method where only a URL and a method is passed.
Wilt applies no checks to this URL nor does it add the
database, the format of this is entirely up to the user.

This can be used for CouchDb functions that are not directly supported by Wilt,
e.g views, attachments and design documents.

children.name: get
children.comment:
Performs an HTTP GET operation, the URL is conditioned and
the current database added.

children.name: head
children.comment:
Performs a HTTP HEAD operation, the URL is conditioned and
the current database added.

children.name: post
children.comment:
Performs a HTTP POST operation,, the URL is conditioned and
the current database added.

children.name: put
children.comment:
Performs a HTTP PUT operation,, the URL is conditioned and
the current database added.

children.name: delete
children.comment:
Performs a HTTP DELETE operation,, the URL is conditioned and
the current database added.

children.name: getDocument
children.comment:
Performs an HTTP GET operation for the supplied document id and
optional revision. If withAttachments is set the the body of
any attachments are also supplied, note this could make this 
a large transfer.

children.name: deleteDocument
children.comment: DELETE's the specified document. Must have a revision.

children.name: putDocument
children.comment:
PUT's to the specified  document.

For an update the revision must be specified, this can be in the
document body as a _rev parameter or specified in the call in which
case this will be added to the document body.

children.name: putDocumentString
children.comment:
PUT's to the specified  document where the document is supplied as 
a JSON string. Must be used if '_id' and or '_rev' are needed.

children.name: postDocument
children.comment:
POST's the specified document.
An optional path to the document can be specified.

children.name: postDocumentString
children.comment:
POST's to the specified  document where the document is supplied as 
a JSON string. Must be used if '_id' and or '_rev' are needed.

children.name: copyDocument
children.comment:
Copies the source document to the destination document with an optional revision
NOTE this method uses the CouchDB COPY method which is not standard HTTP.

children.name: getAllDocs
children.comment:
Get all documents.
The parameters should be self explanatory and are addative.
Refer to the CouchDb documentation for further explanation.

children.name: bulk
children.comment:
Bulk insert
Bulk inserts a list of documents

children.name: bulkString
children.comment:
Bulk insert JSON string version.
Must be used if '_id' and or '_rev' are needed in ANY of the documents

children.name: createDatabase
children.comment: Creates a database with the specified name.

children.name: deleteDatabase
children.comment: Deletes the specified database

children.name: getDatabaseInfo
children.comment: Get information about a database

children.name: getSession
children.comment: Get current session information from CouchDB

children.name: getStats
children.comment: Get current stats from CouchDB

children.name: getAllDbs
children.comment: Get all the databases from CouchDB

children.name: createAttachment
children.comment:
Create an attachment on an existing document.
contentType is in the form of a mime type e.g. 'image/png'
If the document needs to be created as well as the attachment set the rev to ''

children.name: updateAttachment
children.comment:
Update an attachment on an existing document.
contentType is in the form of a mime type e.g. 'image/png'

children.name: deleteAttachment
children.comment: Delete an attachment

children.name: getAttachment
children.comment: Get an attachment

children.name: startChangeNotification
children.comment:
Change notification start, see the WiltChangeNotification class for more details

If a database name is not supplied the currently selected database is used.

children.name: stopChangeNotification
children.comment:
Change notification stop, see the WiltChangeNotification class for more details

Note that this destroys the internal changeNotifier object which can only be 
reinstated by a call to startChangeNotification.

children.name: updateChangeNotificationParameters
children.comment:
Change the parameter set for change notifications.

Note that database name, host, port and scheme are not changeable.

children.name: pauseChangeNotifications
children.comment: Pause change notifications

children.name: restartChangeNotifications
children.comment: Restart change notifications after a pause

children.name: login
children.comment:
Authentication.
Updates the login credentials in Wilt that will be used for all further
requests to CouchDB. Both user name and password must be set, even if one
or the other is '' i.e empty. After logging in all communication with CouchDB
is made using the selected auithentication method.

children.name: generateIds
children.comment: Ask CouchDB to generate document Id's.

children.name: changeNotification
children.comment:
Change notification event stream

This is a broadcast stream so can support more than one listener.

children.name: changeNotificationsPaused
children.comment: Change notification paused state

children.name: SESSION
children.comment: URL constant for CouchDB SESSION function

children.name: STATS
children.comment: URL constant for CouchDB STATS function

children.name: ALLDBS
children.comment: URL constant for CouchDB ALLDBS function

children.name: ALLDOCS
children.comment: URL constant for CouchDB ALLDOCS function

children.name: BULKDOCS
children.comment: URL constant for CouchDB BULKDOCS function

children.name: UUIDS
children.comment: URL constant for CouchDB UUID function

children.name: AUTH_BASIC
children.comment:
AUTH_BASIC denotes Basic HTTP authentication. 
If login is called AUTH_BASIC is set, otherwise it defaults to AUTH_NONE

children.name: AUTH_NONE
children.comment: No authentication

children.name: GET
children.comment: Operation types and method definitions

children.name: _db
children.comment: Database name

children.name: changeNotificationDbName
children.comment: Change notification database name

children.name: _host
children.comment: Host name

children.name: _port
children.comment: Port number

children.name: _scheme
children.comment: HTTP scheme

children.name: _httpAdapter
children.comment: HTTP Adapter

children.name: _changeNotifier
children.comment: Change notification

children.name: _clientCompletion
children.comment: Completion function

children.name: _completionResponse
children.comment: Response getter for completion callbacks

children.name: _user
children.comment: Authentication, user name

children.name: _password
children.comment: Authentication, user password

children.name: authenticationType
children.comment: Authentication, type

Please use the wilt_browser_client or wilt_server_client import files to 
instantiate a Wilt object for use in either the browser or server environment.
You can do this here but you must supply either a browser or server HTTP adapter
to use.
